sen.j: 『仏祖歴代通載』（ぶっそ れきだい つうさい）とは、中国で編纂された、古代より元統 (元)元年（1333年）に及ぶ仏教編年史書である。
sen.e: Busso Rekidai Tsusai is a work compiled in China that chronicles the history of Buddhism from the ancient times to the year 1333.
"Busso Rekidai Tsusai" is a chronicle of Buddhism history from the ancient times to the year 1333, which was compiled in China.
sen.cmt: 原文に『』があるので、訳文にも訳出しています。全文見直しています。
sen.e: "Busso Rekidai Tsusai" is a chronicle of Buddhism history from the ancient times to the year 1333, which was compiled in China.

sen.j: 撰者は、元 (王朝)の梅屋念常。
sen.e: It was complied by Jonen OKUYA of the Yuan Dynasty period.
sen.cmt: 梅屋念常 : Jonen OKUYA （暫定訳）
sen.e: It was complied by 梅屋念常 from the Yuan Dynasty (China).

sen.e: It was complied by 梅屋念常 from the Yuan Dynasty (China).
The work consists of 22 volumes.
The work consists of 22 volumes.
The work consists of 22 volumes.

sen.j: 本書の巻頭にある、1344年の覚岸序によれば、撰者の梅屋念常は、諸方を遊歴して仏教史蹟を踏査している。
sen.e: According to the foreword by Kakugan in the first part of the work, the compiler BAIOKU Nenjo traveled in various areas to search and study works and chronicles on Buddhist history.
sen.cmt: 覚岸序 : forword by Kakugan （試訳）梅屋念常: Baioku Nenjo（試訳）
sen.e: According to the introduction section of Kakugan, in the preface of the work, the compiler 梅屋念常 traveled around various areas and made a survey of historical sites of Buddhism.
sen.cmt: 覚岸→Kakugan読み不明です。（梅屋念常の法弟なる人物だと思われます）in the の前にコンマを追加しました。traveled以降修正しました。
sen.e: According to the introduction section of Kakugan, in the preface of the work, the compiler 梅屋念常 traveled around various areas and made a survey of historical sites of Buddhism.

sen.j: その結果、従来の仏教史書に不十分な点が見られ、諸宗派の伝承、歴代の宰相や顕官による外護のあり様や、禅宗の伝灯に注意が払われていない点などに気づいた、という。
sen.e: In his studies, he reportedly discovered inadequacies in the existing works on Buddhist history and noticed that attention is not being paid on the traditions of the various religious sects, the practices of the lay followers, such as top political leaders and government officials, and preservation of the teachings of Zen Buddhism.

In his survey, he reportedly discovered inadequacies in the existing books of Buddhist history and noticed that attention was not being paid on the traditions of the various religious sects, the protection of temples by successive prime ministers or government officials, and the preservation of the teachings of Zen sect.
sen.cmt: studies→surveyに修正しました。伝灯→a lineage of one-to-one direct transmission of thought from teacher to student.named after
sen.e: In his survey, he reportedly discovered inadequacies in the existing books of Buddhist history and noticed that attention was not being paid on the traditions of the various religious sects, the protection of temples by successive prime ministers or government officials, and the preservation of the teachings of Zen sect.

sen.j: また、1269年に編纂された『仏祖統紀』であっても、なおその体裁に歴史書として欠けるものがある、という。
sen.e: In fact, even Bussotoki (Record of the Lineage of the Buddha and the Patriarchs) that had been compiled in 1269 is claimed to have shortfalls in organization as a historical work.
And even "Bussotoki" (Record of the lineage of the Buddha and the patriarchs) that was compiled in 1269 is claimed to have shortfalls in organization as a historical book.

sen.e: And even "Bussotoki" (Record of the lineage of the Buddha and the patriarchs) that was compiled in 1269 is claimed to have shortfalls in organization as a historical book.

sen.j: その結果、20年余にわたって困苦の末に完成したのが、本書である、としている。
sen.e: The compilation was completed, it claims, to address these problems and after overcoming difficulties over a period of roughly 20 years.
The book says that, as a result, the compilation was completed with effort over 20 years.
The book says that, as a result, the compilation was completed with effort over 20 years.

sen.j: 覚岸の序などでは、このように述べてはいるが、実際は、陳垣がその著書で指摘する通り、本書の内容は、隆興2年（1164年）に著述された『隆興仏教編年通論』29巻の内容を完全に踏襲している。
sen.e: Although such claims are made in Kakugan's foreword, the content of the said work is fully covered in Lung-hsing Fo-chiao pien-nien t'ung-lun written in 1164, as pointed out by CHEN Yuan in his works.
sen.cmt: 覚岸: Kakugan陳垣: CHEN Yuan隆興仏教編年通論: Lung-hsing Fo-chiao pien-nien t'ung-lun
sen.e: Although it is written in the introduction section of Kakugan, in fact, the contents of this book fully followed the Volume 29 of "The General Commentaries on Longxing Chronology" in 1164, as pointed out by Yuan CHEN in his works.
sen.cmt: 全文修正しました。原文の『』が訳出されていません。本のタイトルに英語名が記載されているサイトがあったのhttp://www.phatviet.com/nghiencuu/tsncpl03/ncpl0301.htmでそちらから引用し、修正しました。姓名の順を修正しました。
sen.e: Although it is written in the introduction section of Kakugan, in fact, the contents of this book fully followed the Volume 29 of "The General Commentaries on Longxing Chronology" in 1164, as pointed out by Yuan CHEN in his works.

sen.j: よって、本書中の五代十国時代までの叙述は、その抄出でしかない。
sen.e: For this reason, the description of Buddhist history until Five Dynasties and Ten Kingdoms period is merely copied from its predecessor.
Therefore, the descriptions until the Wudai Shiguo period (the Five Dynasties and Ten Kingdoms period) in the book are merely extracted from "The General Commentaries on Longxing Chronology".
Therefore, the descriptions until the Wudai Shiguo period (the Five Dynasties and Ten Kingdoms period) in the book are merely extracted from "The General Commentaries on Longxing Chronology".

sen.j: よって、本書の特色となる部分は、その巻18より以降の宋代と元代の部分、5巻分である。
sen.e: Therefore, its most distinctive part is found in Volume 18 and later, the 5 volumes that cover the Sung and Yuan dynasties.
The most distinctive part is the Sung and Yuan Dynasties, which are five volumes after Volume 18.
The most distinctive part is the Sung and Yuan Dynasties, which are five volumes after Volume 18.

sen.j: 但し、その叙述には、編年体の記述法から言えば、逸脱した箇所も多々見受けられる。
sen.e: It must be noted, however, that there are quite a few disgressions in terms of a historical account presented in chronological order.
Quite a few descriptions strayed from the original book in terms of descriptive method of chronological order.
sen.cmt: disgression→digressionのミススペルです。全文修正しました。
